author: etan_status
content:
I have created EIP-6404 to track the migration to SSZ.
https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-6404-ssz-transactions-receipts-and-withdrawals/12783
It should still be compatible with the concept of a receipt proof. Do you need the `transaction_hashes_root` that I'm proposing in the EIP, or does it work without that?

author: ncitron
content: Yeah this would work. I don't actually need the tx hash root, since the tx list is already in the execution payload so its easy to fetch those. Could be useful to potentially reduce network usage though, since then I may be able to just download the payload header.

author: bridge-bot
content: <etan_status> the tx hash_tree_root from the execution payload is not the same as the tx_hash that you pass to eth_getReceipt

author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> or, you using keccak256(transaction)? that works, as long as you download full blocks (in which case, obviously, you can recompute it).

but I guess the idea of eth_getReceiptsProof is to not need full blocks anymore
